intro: Koanophyllon sciatraphes, commonly known as the Texas starbursts, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. Koanophyllon sciatraphes is an important plant for pollinators and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
